That was two days ago. Whatever it was still around sometimes it left but anytime you spent too much time in the water it was back. Today though it did something new it had just stayed still when you were in the drink. You'd watched it for a bit and it had watched you until eventually it had swam off and let you relax in the sea. info.brief_description: Be tickled by/tickle your favorite animated women!
info.description:
This is an interactive story where a man or woman, gets to have a tickling experience with women from animated movies or TV shows. Here are a few ground rules:

1) This is a story for adults only, because I intend for it to have sexualized tickling scenarios, and I will award gift points for well-written, detailed, descriptive chapters in this vein. If you are interested in knowing how much, please contact me by private message.

2) All chapters must be written from a second person perspective (ex: you opened the door)

3) No males tickling males. Only females tickling males, males tickling females, or females tickling females. I personally prefer the male POV being tickled by female characters, and will thus award more points for well written chapters of this type than either of the other two types, but all well written chapters of these three types will receive gift points.

4) Scenarios where the tickler(s) uses her/his hands, feet, mouth (licking, kissing, sucking, nibbling, blowing, raspberries, etc) are encouraged.

5) The use of tickle tools (ropes, chains, feathers, oil, honey, brushes, gags, blindfolds, etc.) is encouraged. No part of the body is off limits (hence the 18+ rating)

6) Taunting/teasing and sadism are encouraged.

7) No anime characters. By anime I specifically mean animation of Japanese origin (like Pokemon or Yu-Gi-Oh) and not animation that merely looks like anime (like Avatar: The Last Airbender). I don't have a problem with anime per se, it's just that tickling stories regarding animated characters are generally dominated by anime characters, and I want to create something different.

8) Proper word usage, punctuation, spelling, and grammar, are essential. There are WAY too many interactive stories filled with garbled, barely intelligible chapters, and I don't find that acceptable. I'm not demanding perfection, but I do demand excellence, and will not give gift points for lazily written work.

Please feel free to contact me with questions/suggestions!
